meanings.definition: Having reference to something implied or inferred.
meanings.sent1: Her allusive remarks made everyone think about the hidden meaning.
meanings.sent2: The book was full of allusive hints that required careful reading.
meanings.sent3: The allusive joke made us all laugh at the clever twist.
meanings.sent4: His allusive storytelling painted vivid pictures in our minds.
meanings.sent5: The allusive painting left viewers pondering its deeper message.

meanings.definition: Containing or characterized by indirect references.
meanings.sent1: The movie had an allusive scene that hinted at a famous film.
meanings.sent2: Her speech was allusive, leaving the audience to connect the dots.
meanings.sent3: The allusive advertisement made people curious about the product.
meanings.sent4: His allusive lyrics resonated with listeners on a deeper level.
meanings.sent5: The allusive play kept the audience engaged in deciphering its clues.
